channel.title: [718] Java problem
channel.description:
So my friend has just upgraded the server we've been working on for about 2 months now to 718. When I got the new client, I couldn't play it. It gave me the standard "java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: client : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0" which is saying that it's compiled in a higher version of Java than I have (6_41)
However, we can't seem to figure out why I still cannot run it, as he has compiled in 6 a bunch of times trying to get me able to run it. It's normally just a simple jar, but we've tried doing all sorts of stuff.
He's on the RuneTek 5 engine, which apparently means he can't use 6 on the server. But I don't see why that means I can't run the client itself.
If anybody knows what's going on, that would be fantastic. :)

item.title: [718] Java problem
item.dc:creator: @Squishy410 Squishy410
item.description:
@Squishy410 wrote:

So my friend has just upgraded the server we’ve been working on for about 2 months now to 718. When I got the new client, I couldn’t play it. It gave me the standard “java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: client : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0” which is saying that it’s compiled in a higher version of Java than I have (6_41)

However, we can’t seem to figure out why I still cannot run it, as he has compiled in 6 a bunch of times trying to get me able to run it. It’s normally just a simple jar, but we’ve tried doing all sorts of stuff.

He’s on the RuneTek 5 engine, which apparently means he can’t use 6 on the server. But I don’t see why that means I can’t run the client itself.

If anybody knows what’s going on, that would be fantastic.
